## Table

```{python}
import pandas as pd
from itables import show

data = {
    "Country": ["Denmark","Germany","France","US","Japan"],
    "Yield_10Y": [2.7,2.3,2.5,3.9,0.7],
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
show(df)
```

```{python}
import plotly.express as px
fig = px.scatter(df, x="Country", y="Yield_10Y", title="10-Year Government Bond Yields")
fig  # return the figure to embed
```

```{python}
import plotly.express as px
iso_map = {"Denmark":"DNK","Germany":"DEU","France":"FRA","US":"USA","Japan":"JPN"}
df["iso_alpha"] = df["Country"].map(iso_map)
fig = px.choropleth(df, locations="iso_alpha", color="Yield_10Y",
                    hover_name="Country", title="10-Year Yields by Country")
fig  # return the figure to embed
```
